required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: iSGLT2 in Prevention of Acute Kidney Injury in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus Undergoing CABG Extracorporeal On-Pump
clinical_study.official_title: SGLT2 Inhibitors in Prevention of Acute Kidney Injury in Patients With Diabetes Mellitus Undergoing CABG Extracorporeal On-Pump

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Introduction: Diabetes Mellitus (DM) is a condition known to be associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) and its role as promoter of atherosclerosis is well stablished. The revascularization surgery is commonly indicated to patients with multivessel coronary disease and kidney injury is a prevalent complication in post operation. This work aims to evaluate the impact of a strategy to control Diabetes Mellitus using inhibitors of sodium-glucose cotransporters (ISGLT2) in diabetics patients with assigned myocardial revascularization with cardiopulmonary bypass

detailed_description.textblock:
Random Prospective Study non-blinded with 144 diabetics patients designated to myocardial revascularization with cardiopulmonary bypass . 72 patients will be randomly set to usual treatment provided by health care service and 72 patients will be randomly assigned treatment based on ISGLT2 (Empaglifozin). Patients will receive treatment as set for 3 months until 3 days prior to surgery. Creatinine levels will be measured immediately after surgery and in the following 3 days in post-op.
To evaluate the possibility to reduce the acute kidney injury in a randomized group treated with therapy based on ISGLT2.

primary_outcome.description: Development of post-CABG acute kidney injury according to RIFFLE or AKIN or KDIGO criteria

secondary_outcome.description: Development of atrial fibrillation during hospital admission
Development of pulmonary infection during hospital admission
Development of infection of surgical site during hospital admission
Transfer to ICU during hospital admission
Need for IV insulin during hospital admission
Occurence of myocardial infarction type 5 during admission

arm_group.description: Empagliflozin 25 mg 1 time day for three months
Standard care treatment of diabetes patients in our center

intervention.description: Patients with diabetes waiting for surgery will receive empagliflozin for at least three months.

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto do Coração - Hospital das Clinicas FMUSP

facility.name: University of Sao Paulo Medical School - The Heart Institute

investigator.last_name: Luis Antonio M Cesar, MD, PhD
José Otávio C Auler Jr, MD, PHD
Carlos V Serrano Jr., MD, PhD
